alston.minecraft

Class Chunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Chunk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Chunk
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Holds an array of Blocks and is and handles all initializations of Blocks and find the Blocks they hold. A Chunk is maxBlocks ^2 * maxBlockY in volume. The use of Chunks instead of a direct array of Blocks is to enable the ability to generate a infinite (or almost infinite, being limited by memory) world. The memory that a typical loaded Chunk consumes is approx. 100MB (varying depending on the amount of Blocks that are hidden and have their memory intensive data null-refrenced), while a non-loaded chunk would take maxBlocksY(maxBlocksX^2)(64 bits [float] + 4 (32 bits) [int] + 2 bits [boolean] + 32 to 64 bits, depending on processor [pointer/reference to parent]).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chunk

        public Chunk(int x,
     int y)
        Instantiates a new Array of Block, all the associated Objects to the Chunk, and initiates the variables.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the Chunk in the World
        y - The y coordinate of the Chunk in the World

    • Method Detail

      • getBlock

        public Block getBlock(int x,
             int y,
             int z)
        Gets the Block in the specified coordinates (allows for negatives) from the Chunk by using a divide and conquer search algorithm. If it is not located inside the Chunk, it will attempt to access the Block from the most appropriate Chunk and keep recusively (kinda) doing so until it either finds the Chunk, or reaches an unloaded Chunk, and would then return null.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the specified Block
        y - Y coordinate of the specified Block
        z - Z coordinate of the specified Block
        Returns:
        The specified Block

      • createTree

        public void createTree(int x,
              int y,
              int z,
              boolean updatePhysics)
        Creates a tree at the given coordinates of the bottom of the tree.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate bottom of the tree
        y - The y coordinate bottom of the tree
        z - The z coordinate bottom of the tree
        updatePhysics - If physics should be updated after this (not generated from chunk creation)

      • updateCollisionShape

        public void updateCollisionShape()
        Either submits a new thread that will concurrently create a new CollisionShape to update the old one, or check on it to see if it's done.

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Restores the chunk's node and controls. To be called from a seperate thread from the Main/Render thread.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the block by removing all refrences (including to Render/Physics) to any memory intensive Objects so they will be eligible for Garbage Collection and frees up RAM. To be called concurrently of the Main/Render thread.

      • getSurfaceHeight

        public int getSurfaceHeight(int x,
                   int z)
        Goes from the top of the map and continues to go down until it finds the highest non-air Block in a specific spot, given the x and z coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the spot
        z - The z coordinate of the splot
        Returns:
        The y coordinate of the highest non-air Block
